I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might causet

The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain imobil

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be t

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.

The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun i

The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pa

I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee the

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be con

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be conscious to inject with the E

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be conscious to inject with the Epi Pen.  I look around without moving my head to see w

I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is i

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is in

The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be conscious to inject with the Epi Pen.  I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is in the know about my allerg

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be conscious to inject with the Epi Pen.  I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is in the know about my allergy.  I don't see anyone.

Hobson's choice he

I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be conscious to inject with the Epi Pen.  I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is in the know about my allergy.  I don't see anyone.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!  I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be conscious to inject with the Epi Pen.  I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is in the know about my allergy.  I don't see anyone.

Hobson's choice here, move and risk a sting, stand still and risk a sting and be in no shape to save myself

I'm very hot and very tired and I want to go inside.  I want to be anywhere else but here with this dratted bee.  I'm becoming afraid that standing here much longer in the full sun in this heat will make me pass out.  If the bee then stings me I won't be conscious to inject with the Epi Pen.  I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is in the know about my allergy.  I don't see anyone.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?". The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

I look around without moving my head to see who else is around who is in the know about my allergy.  I don't see anyone.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"  I wonder "What was in that Kool Aid I had a few minutes ago?".  I freeze in place. I hope my rigid posture indicates to those around that something is wrong.  I want to check my pocket for my Epi Pen but I'm afraid any movement might cause the bee to sting me.  The Epi Pen will save my life but being stung is a frightful thing for me.  I'm a little boy again, watching my father die from a bee sting.

It's hot.  Sweat trickles all over me including into my eyes.  Still, I remain immobile.  Jeez, it seems like hours I've been standing here.  Why doesn't this bee take off and go find some sweet flower to sip from?  I'm not a flower, I'm a human being!

I can see the bee out of the corner of my eye.  It's sitting there just as pretty as you please as if it has a right to be there.  Fly away, fly away I think to myself, that's why you have wings!
